page.title: 10CARS AND ROADS
page.content: There are{18 miles}of road on Lismore looked after by{one roadman}with a {part-time assistant.}The road is classed as a{B}road. There are about{40}cars and vans on the island .{More}come in the{summer {by boat from}Oban and bring visitors. About{14 cars}are kept on the mainland in{Appin}by residents. There are four Land Rovers, one lorry, three or four motor bikes and some push bikes on Lismore. { Lorries}come from Oban carrying{hay and{fertiliser}and taking away{lambs. They can now come and go without waiting for a high tide. An{M.O.T.}certificate is{not required since there is no testing station on the island,and{learner drivers}may drive without a qualified driver in the car. Petrol and occasionally a policeman come from Appin.
